It is characterized by its small, leaf-like structures that are typically arranged in a dense, carpet-like growth pattern. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, develop from specialized leaves called calyptrae. Centrosolenia bryogeton plays an important role in nutrient cycling and soil stabilization in its native habitats.
